name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant increase due to the electronegativity of fluorine, raising the melting point by approximately +20 °C. The hydroxyl group introduces hydrogen bonding potential, which can contribute to the melting point, estimated at around +5 °C. The carboxylic acid group introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 °C.
